title: Ticket #3168: Dead code
description:
From Florian Weimer -

Scheduler::abort_job() in src/condor_schedd.V6/schedd.cpp does not require authentication beyond the WRITE level and does not check if the job owner matches the user making the request.

As a result, local users can abort any idle job, bypassing the restriction enforced by condor_rm.

From Matt -

KILL_FRGN_JOB was introduced in, 

commit 6ad56fef0a28d1399c63dffce20411aeb47614ef
Author: sashwin <sashwin>
Date:   Sat Apr 12 22:30:36 1997 +0000
    Added a function to abort a job [abort_job_myself()] and made abort_jo() call
    it. The new function is also called by qmgmt.C functions which were updated
    earlier to automatically abort a job when it was deleted from the Q.

KILL_FRGN_JOB was renamed to DEACTIVATE_CLAIM_FORCIBLY in, 

commit 9423470db636f8e90133e3a12ed9ce955ae655e1
Author: wright <wright>
Date:   Thu Oct 30 21:21:07 1997 +0000
    Added more startd commands

At its introduction it was used by condor_rm to remove jobs.

Sometime ~6.3 (2002, closest ref is d1486a76) condor_rm changed to use ACT_ON_JOBS, but KILL_FRGN_JOB was still exposed from the condor_schedd.

There are currently (~2c386c41) no uses of the condor_schedd's KILL_FRGN_JOB or DEACTIVATE_CLAIM_FORCIBLY.
